Overview.Summary: The 2024 Finnish presidential election will take place on January 28, with the possibility of a second round on February 11 (1, 4). Advance voting will be available in Australia, New Zealand, and abroad from January 17-20 and January 31-February 3 (4, 5, 7). The president of Finland will serve a term of six years (1). In 2023, the Finnish Court annulled the 2023 Sámi elections (3). In 2024, Vice President Joe Biden dropped out of the presidential race (2) and the current president's pony was killed by a wolf (8). The World Masters Orienteering Championships will be held in the Turku region in Finland from August 2-9, 2024 (9).

Timeline.Text: Advance voting for the 2024 Finnish presidential election begins in Australia and New Zealand.
Advance voting for the 2024 Finnish presidential election begins in Italy.
Advance voting for the 2024 Finnish presidential election begins in Türkiye.
The presidential election takes place in Finland, with Finnish citizens voting for their next president.
Advance voting for a possible second round of the presidential election begins abroad.
Advance voting for a possible second round of the presidential election ends abroad.
Finnish power workers go on strike at nuclear and hydro plants.
The possible second round of the presidential election takes place in Finland.
The World Masters Orienteering Championships 2024 begins in Turku, Finland.
Finnish politician Stubb wins the presidential election.
US President Joe Biden announces that he will not seek re-election in 2024.
US Vice President Kamala Harris delivers a speech at a campaign event in Wisconsin.
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announces plans to address wolf attacks in Finland.

President Luis Abinader declared himself the winner of the Dominican Republic's election (1), while polls in the US showed the performance of Kamala Harris against Donald Trump (4) and the results of the 2016 presidential election (9). In Europe, projections and estimates were made based on polling data (7). In the US, exit polls were conducted during the 2020 presidential election (2) and live coverage was provided for primary races (3,5,8). Fact-checking was also done during the presidential debate (6).

Timeline.Text: The results of the Louisiana primary are announced, giving insight into the upcoming presidential election.
President Biden announces his decision to drop out of the race, endorsing Vice President Harris as the Democratic nominee.
Estimates and projections for the European Parliament elections are published, including data from the Maltese election.
Polling is conducted for the 2024 presidential election in Virginia.
The Dominican Republic's current president declares himself the winner of the presidential election.
Exit polls from the 2020 presidential election show that 57% of voters making less than $50,000 voted in favor of the Republican candidate.
Fact-checking is conducted on the first presidential debate of the 2024 cycle between President Biden and former President Trump.
Results from the 2016 presidential election are analyzed, including the favorability of President Biden.

Timeline.Text: Finland's presidential election is held and Alexander Stubb is elected as the new President.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announces the suspension of elections due to political tensions.
The United States presidential election of 1912 is referenced in relation to Theodore Roosevelt's previous presidency.
President Joe Biden faces a political crisis and is increasingly isolated from his party.
The United States presidential election of 2024 is held, with incumbent President Joe Biden facing off against Republican nominee and former President Donald Trump.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Finnish presidential election will take place on January 28, 2024, with a possible second round on February 11, 2024 (1, 6, 9). The candidates will stand for election in the entire country (1). Advance voting will be possible abroad from January 17 to 20, 2024 (7, 16), and in Australia and New Zealand from January 17 to 19, 2024 (6). The election may consist of two rounds, and the second round will be held between the top two candidates (1). The election will be between the entire country, and the top two candidates will face each other in a second round if needed (1).

Timeline.Text: Finland holds its presidential election. Candidates stand for election in the entire country.
The United States presidential election of 1912 is discussed and compared to the current election in Finland.
Dominican Republic's president declares himself the winner of the election.
President Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race.
Rerun Sámi election in Finland prompts 22 complaints.
Essi Lehto wins the close-fought Finnish presidential election.

The US presidential election takes place, with Kamala Harris as a candidate.
EU Commissioner Urpilainen announces her candidacy for the Finnish presidential election.
An article discusses the crucial swing states in the American election.
Instructions for early voting in the 2024 presidential election are released.
Several Finnish companies announce their second-quarter results.
Finland passes a law allowing border agents to turn away asylum seekers at the border.
President Alexander Stubb gives a speech at the Annual Dinner for the Diplomatic Corps.
